data.title: Allow searching the Change Language Mode screen by associated file extensions
data.body:
For example, if the list of languages is being displayed and you want to change the language to `C#`:
![](https://puu.sh/w0Epy/e70ef4c535.png)

It would be great if you could search for it by file extension `cs` and have it show up in the results.
![](https://puu.sh/w0EDx/35c51d23af.png)

_Side note: `cs` currently doesn't match `csharp`, even though it is displayed in parentheses next to the language name. Is this a bug/oversight?_

Similarly, being able to search for Markdown with `md`, YAML with `yml`, and C++ with `cpp` would be great.

data.title: I can't type the pipe symbol in Visual Studio Code
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: OSX El Capitan 10.11.6

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a file
1. Try ALT+SHIFT+L

Nothing happens.

data.title: Allow to set editor background/foreground when used as a widget (output, debug)
data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:

1. set `panel.background`
2. look at output and debug console where we use an editor and notice that the color is not inherited to the widget

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/26446992/cd552ad8-4146-11e7-834b-b7b0ac2d8205.png)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/26447002/d2c4976a-4146-11e7-8f8e-cdd5499a710d.png)

Is it possible for me to pass in the colors to use by the editor in such a case? I think that would be cool to support a panel that has a different background compared to the editor.

data.title: Collapsing PHP function with heredoc strings fails
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.12.2 (19222cdc84ce72202478ba1cec5cb557b71163de, 2017-05-10T13:20:36.315Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|php-debug|felixfbecker|1.10.0|
|crane|HvyIndustries|0.3.6|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Copy paste the function snippet below.
2. Collapse it (click on the '+' sign on the left)
3. Collapsing fails.

Code example:
funtion onefunction()
{
    string heredocString = <<<BATMAN
    I love bats.
BATMAN;

    $superman = "I love bragging.";
}

Hi I am having problems with Javascript within my project. I have 5 javascript files and I use module revealing pattern. For some reason actions like "Find All References" does not work. It works fine for the same project when I use WebStorm. I tried the same project on another computer with fresh VSC installation and got the same issue. Is this normal?

data.title: Regex not respected in 'getWordRangeAtPosition'
data.body:
I am having issues with the method 'getWordRangeAtPostition' of TextDocument. The problem is that the regex added as second argument is not respected.

This is my code:
`
const wordRange = editor.document.getWordRangeAtPosition(selection.active, /[a-zA-Z0-9_[[:space:]]]*/);`

Using this example: 

`"bla bla bla bla" `

To my understanding, the four words should be selected, as the [[:space:]] regex indicates that spaces are part of words. But the behaviour is the same than without the regex (only 1 word is selected).

data.title: explorer display issue(while using file icon theme seti)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.12.2 (19222cdc84ce72202478ba1cec5cb557b71163de, 2017-05-10T13:20:36.315Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.3.9600
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|vscode-svgviewer|cssho|1.2.0|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.11|
|python|donjayamanne|0.6.4|
|java-debug|DSnake|0.0.2|
|tslint|eg2|0.15.0|
|language-polymer|jonwolfe|0.7.8|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.10.5|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.4.1|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|0.7.2|
|Theme-MarkdownKit|ms-vscode|0.1.4|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|3.1.1|
|java|redhat|0.0.11|
|svg-snippets|sidthesloth|1.0.0|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. create new file named 'obj'.
2. delete file 'obj'.
3. create new directory named 'obj'
4. now the directory 'obj' is displayed with a icon.
5. delete an existed directory named 'src'
6. create new file named 'src'
7. now the file 'src' is displayed without a icon.

screenshot:
![screenshot](https://master76.github.io/res/issue-vscode-v1.12.2-explorer.png)

|vscode-svgviewer|cssho|1.4.0|
|phpunit|emallin|1.0.0|
|json-tools|eriklynd|1.0.2|

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Wait for notification about update or check for updates.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. When I am writing a markdown file with Microsoft Wubi  IME (or other Chinese IME),  I switch to another application and switch back.
2. At this time the IME does not change,  but when stroke the keyboard the input is directly English letter and not a IME input code, so I need to delete the letter and input again.
3. I test it in other editor to make sure it's not the problem of the IME.

data.title: Feature request: Ability to open new window as clone of first one
data.body:
this is sort-of expansion of [#25329](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/25329) ...

I know about 'New Window' command, but that just open new instance of vscode thats is separated from first one.

What i have in mind is open new window and open there any panel (output, explorer, ...) that show same 'data' as corresponding panel in first window.

Another way to go is to be able dettach any panel from main window into its own window like visual studio can ...

data.title: Typescript compiler shows unexisting error (React-Router 4)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.12.2 (19222cdc84ce72202478ba1cec5cb557b71163de, 2017-05-10T13:16:25.899Z) - OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-71-generic - Extensions: |Extension|Author|Version| |---|---|---| |vscode-generate-getter-setter|DSKWRK|0.4.2| |EditorConfig|EditorConfig|0.9.3| |material-icon-theme|PKief|2.0.6| |code-settings-sync|Shan|2.7.0| |html-snippets|abusaidm|0.1.0| |vscode-color|anseki|0.4.1| |one-monokai|azemoh|0.2.4| |vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.11| |githistory|donjayamanne|0.2.0| |vscode-babel-coloring|dzannotti|0.0.4| |vscode-html-css|ecmel|0.1.4| |tslint|eg2|0.15.0| |vscode-npm-script|eg2|0.1.9| |vscode-JS-CSS-HTML-formatter|lonefy|0.2.3| |debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|3.1.1| |vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.7.0| |JavaScriptSnippets|xabikos|1.4.0| |ReactSnippets|xabikos|1.3.0| |Material-theme|zhuangtongfa|2.8.0|; --- Error occurs on `component={Counter}` when trying to attach a component to the Route. The problem: `Counter` has it's `props` and `state` set to ``. Webpack with awesome-typescript-loader compiles this code without any errors. The way to get rid of error message is to pass `Counter as any` or `Counter as React.ComponentClass` Why does VS Code and Webpack compilers have different behaviour? How can it be fixed? **VS Code error message:** ``` severity: 'Error' message: 'Type '{ path: "/counter"; component: ComponentClass<{}>; }' is not assignable to type 'IntrinsicAttributes & IntrinsicClassAttributes & Readonly<{ children?: ReactNode; }> & Rea...'. Type '{ path: "/counter"; component: ComponentClass<{}>; }' is not assignable to type 'Readonly'. Types of property 'component' are incompatible. Type 'ComponentClass<{}>' is not assignable to type 'StatelessComponent | undefined> | ComponentClass' is not assignable to type 'ComponentClass | undefined>'. Type '{}' is not assignable to type 'RouteComponentProps | undefined'. Type '{}' is not assignable to type 'RouteComponentProps'. Property 'match' is missing in type '{}'.' at: '22,13' source: 'ts' ``` ``` import { BrowserRouter as Router, Route, Link } from 'react-router-dom'; import Counter from './counter'; class App extends React.Component { render() { return (
  • Counter
 ); } ``` **package.json** ``` "devDependencies": { "@types/node": "^7.0.18", "@types/react": "^15.0.24", "@types/react-dom": "^15.5.0", "@types/react-hot-loader": "^3.0.1", "@types/react-redux": "^4.4.40", "@types/react-router": "^4.0.9", "@types/react-router-dom": "^4.0.4", "@types/redux": "^3.6.0", "@types/webpack": "^2.2.15", "@types/webpack-dev-server": "^1.12.6", "@types/webpack-env": "^1.13.0", "awesome-typescript-loader": "^3.1.3", "css-loader": "^0.28.1", "extract-text-webpack-plugin": "^2.1.0", "html-webpack-plugin": "^2.28.0", "jest": "^20.0.3", "react-hot-loader": "next", "style-loader": "^0.17.0", "ts-jest": "^20.0.4", "tslint": "^5.2.0", "tslint-react": "^3.0.0", "typescript": "^2.3.2", "webpack": "^2.5.1", "webpack-dashboard": "^0.4.0", "webpack-dev-server": "^2.4.5" }, "dependencies": { "react": "^15.5.4", "react-dom": "^15.5.4", "react-redux": "^5.0.5", "react-router": "^4.1.1", "react-router-dom": "^4.1.1", "redux": "^3.6.0" } } ```
